titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Elena Humphreys Riot Grrrl Collection
1972-1998 (bulk 1991-1996)
MSS 394
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Greer, 2014.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-10-15T16:46-0400

did.abstract: The Elena Humphreys Riot Grrrl Collection consists of material personally collected by Humphreys while she was involved in the Riot Grrrl movement in the 1990s, as well as material generated by and related to Riot Grrrl NYC's activities including zine-making and distribution, activism, and events.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Elena Humphreys Riot Grrrl Collection; MSS 394; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections is not the copyright owner for this collection. Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Researchers wishing to reproduce collection material should contact rights holders for permission.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection arrived with no discernible order and the archivist arranged the materials into two series and one oversize series.

Series I: Riot Grrrl New York City
Series II: Zines, Ephemera, and Catalogs
Oversize Series 1: Riot Grrrl New York City
Materials in the oversize series were removed from the regular series due to size and correspond exactly to that series in content and arrangement.

Within each series, materials are arranged alphabetically by title of zine or catalog, or when no title was applicable, by genre. Correspondence has been arranged alphabetically by last name, or by first name when the last name was unknown.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: This collection was donated to the Fales Library by Elena Humphreys in Spring of 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Elena Humphreys Riot Grrrl Collection consists of material personally collected by Humphreys while she was involved in the Riot Grrrl movement in the 1990s. These materials include zines, zine catalogs, record catalogs, and ephemera. The collection also contains material generated by and related to Riot Grrrl NYC's activities including zine-making and distribution, activism, and events. These materials include zines, paste-ups for zines, posters, flyers, and other ephemera, correspondence, clippings, mailing lists, and other material.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elena Humphreys is a designer living in New York City. In the 1990s, she was heavily involved in the New York punk scene and was an active member of Riot Grrrl New York City.

Riot Grrrl New York City was a group of young women in New York City in the 1990s that were together involved in the broader Riot Grrrl movement. Their involvement was expressed through activism, music, and zine creation and distribution, among other activities.

did.unittitle: Series I: Riot Grrrl New York City

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series I: Riot Grrrl New York City: This series contains materials related to and produced by Riot Grrl New York City in connection with their work organizing events and creating zines. Materials include zines, flyers, clippings, correspondence, paste-ups used to create zines and flyers, mailing lists, and other materials.

did.unittitle: Series II: Zines, Ephemera, and Catalogs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of zines, ephemera, and catalogs collected by Elena Humphreys related to the Riot Grrrl Movement and punk culture in general.

did.unittitle: Bikini Kill: A Color and Activity Book
Facts About Dieting and Eating Disorders
Lost I.D.: Feminist Women of Color Shout
The Murder Can Be Fun 1994 Datebook
My Need to Speak on the Subject of Jackson Pollock
No Choice XX: Oakland Straight Edge
Riot Grrrls Outer Space Cool Stuff Catalog, #1
Self Help, It's About Women and Our Empowerment
A Special Book for Boys and Girls
Tenacious D's Voyage Through His Black & White, 2-Dimensional Life
Women's Underground Music Directory for NYC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Vintage suitcase circa 1940s, in which Humphreys stored her archive of riot grrrl material. Suitcase is covered in riot grrrl stickers, band stickers, and other political stickers.

did.unittitle: Oversize Series I: Riot Grrrl New York City

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Oversize Series I: Riot Grrrl New York City:This series corresponds in scope and content to Series I. These materials were separated due to size.
